    • Method Detail

      • characterToPiece

        public static Piece characterToPiece(char characterOfPiece)
        Given a character, characterToPiece return the Piece that correspond to the character. The Uppercase character are for White pieces, lowercase character are for Black pieces.
        Parameters:
        characterOfPiece: - the character can be A,a (archer),G,g (giant),D,d (dragon),S,s (squire),K,k (knight),M,m (mage)
        Returns:
        an instance of the class Giant, Mage, Archer, Dragon, Squire or Knight

      • pieceToCharacter

        public static char pieceToCharacter(Piece piece)
        Given an instance of an implementation of Piece, pieceToCharacter return a character
        Parameters:
        piece - an instance of the class Giant, Mage, Archer, Dragon, Squire or Knight
        Returns:
        a char: A,a (archer),G,g (giant),D,d (dragon),S,s (squire),K,k (knight),M,m (mage)

      • updateBoard

        public static void updateBoard(java.lang.String boardString,
                               java.lang.String vitalityString,
                               Match match)
        UpdateBoard update the board creating new object with a certain vitality in the right position
        Parameters:
        boardString - is a string of dimension size*size. The chars can be: G (giant), M (mage), S (squire), K (knight), D (dragon), A (archer), 0 (empty) The letters are UPPERCASE for white and lowercase for black
        vitalityString - a string of dimension maxPiece (16) that represent the vitality of the pieces
        match - the match that we are considering

      • updateVitality

        public static void updateVitality(java.lang.String vitalityString,
                                  Match match)
        UpdateVitality update the vitality of the pieces on the board
        Parameters:
        vitalityString - a string of dimension maxPiece (16) that represent the vitality of the pieces
        match - the match that we are considering

      • updateBoard

        public static void updateBoard(java.lang.String boardString,
                               Match match)
        UpdateBoard update the board creating new object with their max vitality in the right position
        Parameters:
        boardString - is a string of dimension size*size. The chars can be: G (giant), M (mage), S (squire), K (knight), D (dragon), A (archer), 0 (empty) The letters are UPPERCASE for white and lowercase for black
        match - the match that we are considering

      • vitalityToString

        public static java.lang.String vitalityToString(Match match)
        VitalityToString return a string that describes the board
        Parameters:
        match - the match that we are considering
        Returns:
        a string of the vitality of the pieces. The board is scanned by column from left to right. If there are less than 16 pieces, the string is zero-padded

      • boardToString

        public static java.lang.String boardToString(Match match)
        BoardToString return a string of characters, scanning the table by row, from top to bottom, from left to right
        Returns:
        a string of the pieces in the board

      • setFrozenFromString

        public static void setFrozenFromString(java.lang.String frozenPiecesString,
                                       Match match)
        SetFrozenFromString set the frozen Pieces in the board
        Parameters:
        frozenPiecesString: - the string as explained in the slides
        match: - the match that we are considering

        public static java.lang.String getFrozenPiecesAsString(Match match)
        GetFrozenPiecesAsString gives a representation of the frozen Pieces as a String
        Parameters:
        match - the match that we are considering
        Returns:
        the string of frozen Pieces, as explained in the slides
